title: Sammy Watkins and his agent reportedly told Buffalo Bills to get him more targets
text:
Orchard Park, N.Y. — Sammy Watkins knows what type of wide receiver he is, and he thinks the Buffalo Bills aren't giving him the opportunity to show it.
Speaking to Tyler Dunne of The Buffalo News , Watkins said he spoke to his agent about needing to get more targets in the passing game, and his agent passed along those concerns to the Bills.
Following the Bills' Week 1 win over the Indianapolis Colts in which Watkins failed to catch a pass, he said his lack of targets would only be a problem if the Bills start losing . Apparently, it's now a problem.
"That's what I get mad at, when I don't get looked at," Watkins told The Buffalo News. "I can look at film and his eyes go straight that way and I'm not getting looked at, at all. That's when I get frustrated. When I have one-on-one coverage, go to me. I don't care what's going on over there. I don't care if he's open. When I get one on one, just target me."
The second-year receiver has five games with double-digit targets in the 19 NFL games he's played in. Watkins compares that to players like Julio Jones in Atlanta and Odell Beckham Jr. in Atlanta and can't help but wonder what he would do with consistently higher target numbers.
"Everybody looks at you getting zero catches, zero yards but when you look on film 90 percent of the time you're open," Watkins told The News. "I understand that these guys are young and they need some time to trust me. Once we get that trust, it'll be different. But for me, I need the ball at least 10 times — I need 10 targets — and I'll be fine with however many yards I get. And that's what I addressed in talking with my agent. We reached out to a couple people and tried to pull some strings like, 'Hey, I need my targets. You came up to draft me and I'm not getting targets — that's a problem. You're making me look bad and you're making yourself look bad. Why not make both of us look good?'"
While Watkins certainly has a point, he also has to get on the field. He's missed the last two weeks with a calf injury that has one again limited him in practice this week. Watkins insists he's going to fight through the injury , because he thinks the Bills' offense is "basic" without him in the lineup.
